text:
Aqueductal (pencil) glioma presenting as neurogenic pulmonary edema: a case report.
 A case of neurogenic pulmonary edema due to hydrocephalus, without initial neurological deficit, is described.
 Computed tomography demonstrated a ring enhancing lesion in the tectum of the mesencephalon obstructing the aqueduct of Sylvius.
 The lesion, on autopsy, was a rare mesencephalic glioma described in the literature as a "pencil glioma" of the aqueduct.
